remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionEventArgs.TextComposition%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is a FrameworkTextComposition when the user enters text into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBox> by using an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ime](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] and the <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInput>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInputUpdate>, or <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInputStart> event occurs.
FrameworkTextComposition is the base class of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FrameworkRichTextComposition>. The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FrameworkRichTextComposition> class defines properties that return <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> objects to indicate the position of the text composition. When the user enters text into a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionEventArgs.TextComposition%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FrameworkRichTextComposition>.

Docs.summary: Gets the length of the current composition in Unicode symbols.
Docs.value: The length of the current composition in Unicode symbols.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CompositionLength property indicates how many characters have been entered since the last <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInput> event. This property is only meaningful when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInputStart> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInputUpdate> event occurs. When the <xref:System.Windows.Input.TextCompositionManager.TextInput> event occurs, CompositionLength is –1, and the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FrameworkTextComposition.ResultLength%2A> property indicates the length of the composition.
CompositionLength is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
